newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan software houses agree on wholesale venture.
newsitem.headline: Japan software houses agree on wholesale venture.

text.p: Japanese software firm Square Co Ltd said on Tuesday that it and five other major software houses have agreed on a joint venture to market videogame software in convenience stores.

Square said the five software firms, Capcom Co Ltd, Namco Ltd, Konami Co, Enix Corp 9684 Q and Hudson Soft Co Ltd, are expected to buy stakes in Digicube Co Ltd, a venture which Square set up in March for the new enterprise.
However, Square said the six companies have yet to agree on how large a stake each partner will have in Digicube.
Square also said it would ask Capcom and Namco to dispatch some staff to Digicube as board members.
Digicube plans to start marketing videogame software in convenience stores in November, the software firms said in a joint statement.
